mobs.long_desc: A skulking scout of the Split Skull regiment scans the area.
mobs.desc: This ugly green troll seems to have no difficulty moving around in the swamps. His lanky legs are ideal for navigating the watery ground, and his skinny frame blends in rather well with the mangrove trees and roots.  His claws and teeth are bloody, as though he has recently eaten something raw.

mobs.keywords: patrol patroller skulk skulking warrior troll
mobs.long_desc: A skulking warrior patrols the area.
mobs.desc: A muscular specimen of the usually skinny troll race, this scowling warrior doesn't seem to mind indiscriminantly attacking anything that moves: ripples in the water, falling leaves, animals unlucky enough to come near it, and in fact just about everything except those it recognizes as allies.

mobs.long_desc: A massive warrior guards the entrance.
mobs.desc: This huge, scarred ogre guards the gates of Split Skull from any intruders of the good persuasion.  A large tattoo on his forehead in the shape of the Split Skull attests to his loyalty.  Though he looks very strong, ogres are not known for their intelligence or good looks: his eyes are beady and dull, and living in a swamp does not seem to improve his smell.

mobs.long_desc: A Skulking berserker roams aimlessly.
mobs.desc: This is a lanky green creature that though shorter than his relative trolls shows scarred ropey extrimities as though they have nearly been torn off at times from wild frenzied swinging beyond muscular capabilities.  There is a crazed gleam in the eye when a gaze is cast your way.

mobs.long_desc: A Split Skull guard prowls around the settlement.
mobs.desc: With eyes as sharp as his teeth, this troll is constantly scanning the muddy streets of Split Skull for trouble and breaking it up where necessary. Equally at home on the ground, in the swampy water, and in the mangrove trees, he is quick to spot anything out of place.

mobs.long_desc: A Split Skull guard prowls around the settlement.
mobs.desc: With eyes as sharp as his teeth, this troll is constantly scanning the muddy streets of Split Skull for trouble and breaking it up where necessary. Equally at home on the ground, in the swampy water, and in the mangrove trees, he is quick to spot anything out of place.

mobs.long_desc: A grunt of the outpost glances around himself cautiously.
mobs.desc: This wary-looking troll has clearly seen combat before.  His greenish skin hekps him blend in easier with the swamps, and his easy, loping stride assures that he will be the first on the scene if a dangerous situation arises. Constantly on the lookout for trouble, his eyes gleam with eagerness at the thought of battle.

mobs.long_desc: A grunt of the outpost looks to the trees for trouble.
mobs.desc: This common troll soldier is on the lookout for trouble, though he seems to be ignoring what's going on in the encampment in favor of watching the mangrove swamps.  His skin is a mossy green, and he has bulging muscles.  There aren't any scars visible on his body, though whether this means he is young and inexperienced or is just a tribute to the regenerative powers of the troll isn't immediately obvious.

mobs.long_desc: An ogre blends in with the crowd as he walks by.
mobs.desc: Average size, average skin tone, and an average set of features combine to let this ogre blend in seamlessly with the crowd at Split Skull.  In fact, if he weren't an ogre, he'd be completely inconspicuous.  He'd probably stand out quite badly in any human settlement.

mobs.long_desc: An orc stands nearby studying the arcane.
mobs.desc: Though strong and vicious looking this Orc is a student of the arcane arts. Arrayed in various cloth finery to allow to the necessary movements and semantics to call forth an arcane demise to his foes.

mobs.long_desc: A large troll labors over a hammer and anvil.
mobs.desc: This troll seems even more muscular than the average troll, with an unhealthy-looking grey hide and a glint in his eyes to match the one at his forge.  His right arm is massive from hammering hot metal all day long, and his left arm is barely any smaller.

mobs.long_desc: The Split Skull Supplier takes inventory.
mobs.desc: This troll is taller than most and though muscular looks out of place and bored with his duties as supplier of the forces in the area.  His eyes seem sharp and attentive to small detail.

mobs.long_desc: The Stablemaster feeds the nightmares.
mobs.desc: Marching around with an air of importance not to be mocked by the other residents of Split Skull, this troll has a way with animals uncommon to most members of his race.  Maybe it's the lack of bloodstains on his teeth.  In any case, the various mounts that call the stables their home seem to respect him and become calm in his presence.

mobs.long_desc: A very large troll stands behind the bar.
mobs.desc: This troll is short by troll standards but is as wide as an Orc.  He is older and his face is pitted and scarred by what must have been life long combat.  It seems he's probably the meanest looking creature you have ever seen, but he's actually encouraging, even leading, this party!

mobs.long_desc: The Innkeeper rests behind her desk.
mobs.desc: This trollop skulks about the inn frustrated to be relegated to such duties. She is tall and lanky and nearly equal in muscle to any of the male warriors you've seen.

mobs.long_desc: An Elite Split Skull Grunt patrols the path.
mobs.desc: This uncommon troll soldier is on the lookout for trouble, though he seems to be ignoring what's going on in the trees in favor of watching the mangrove swamps.  His skin is a mossy green, and he has bulging muscles.  There are many scars visible on his body and he seems older than others you've seen.  This fighter is more experienced than ones you've noticed before.

mobs.long_desc: An Elite Split Skull Grunt scans the outpost below.
mobs.desc: This uncommon troll soldier is on the lookout for trouble, though he seems to be ignoring what's going on in the trees in favor of watching the mangrove swamps.  His skin is a mossy green, and he has bulging muscles.  There are many scars visible on his body and he seems older than others you've seen.  This fighter is more experienced than ones you've noticed before.

mobs.long_desc: An Elite Skulking Berserker manages his temper.
mobs.desc: This is a bulky dark creature that while no shorter than his relative trolls shows scarred ropey extrimities as though they have nearly been torn off at times from wild frenzied swinging beyond muscular capabilities.  His shoulders and upper arms are exposed with no armor as though they are not encumbered for some reason.  There is a crazed gleam in the eye when a gaze is cast your way.

mobs.long_desc: An Elite Skulking Berserker fails to manage his temper!
mobs.desc: This is a bulky dark creature that while no shorter than his relative trolls shows scarred ropey extrimities as though they have nearly been torn off at times from wild frenzied swinging beyond muscular capabilities.  His shoulders and upper arms are exposed with no armor as though they are not encumbered for some reason.  There is a crazed gleam in the eye when a gaze is cast your way.

mobs.long_desc: A dark priest prays nearby.
mobs.desc: This dark green skinned Orc is covered head to toe in numerous tattoos and ritual scars proving his devotion to the dark gods.  He wears thick black leather armor to protect himself from the creatures of the swamp.  Around his neck hangs a green flame, the unholy symbol of Zzur.

mobs.long_desc: A skulking mercenary leers at you.
mobs.desc: Markedly different than the other trolls at the Split Skull emcampment, his skin is closer to brown than green and he proudly wears the badge of a mercenary group rather than that of the Split Skull.  His eyes gleam with more free will than the other troll soldiers.

mobs.long_desc: A guard of the Grrk regiment patrols the trees.
mobs.desc: This is a very large ogre wearing what must be hundreds of pounds of heavy plate armor.  It's amazing that the trees, bridges, and platforms can hold this creature as easily as they do.  He has shorter fangs than that of the trolls but they are none the less bloodied as though he's just found a fresh human to snack on between meals.

mobs.long_desc: A frost orc holding a spellbook pays you little attention.
mobs.desc: Like his sorcerous peer this Orc is wearing cloth armor to allow the freedom of movement necessary to cast spells.  Though this Orc's clothing is quite thicker in places as though he's seeking a bit of protection from the cold.

mobs.long_desc: A crazed dark paladin has a gleam in his eye.
mobs.desc: This once dark green orc has gone pale green with prolonged exposure to the dark flame.  Black plate armors cover him head to toe and his eyes glow dark red marking his service and life turned to his chaotic master.

mobs.short_desc: the Captain of the Skulking Guard
mobs.long_desc: The Captain of the Skulking Guard appraises his grunts.
mobs.desc: The Captain is a large troll more natually giften than his peers.  However his rank is a product of his battle experience not his physical gifts.  He surveys his recruits and underlings looking to let loose a quick lesson in pain to assist them in their growth as fighters.

mobs.short_desc: a minion of the Dark Flame
mobs.long_desc: A follower of the Dark Flame meditates here.
mobs.desc: So dark, she is almost naturally invisible. One of the most elusive creatures in all the realms, a drow.  Why is she on the surface, what is she up to? Your wonder at the force driving mostly mindless trolls and orcs into constructing such an elaborate fortification and arraying themselves as an offensive force has come to an end.  As well as your life..

mobs.long_desc: A Black Legion Emissary sizes you up with a quick glance.
mobs.desc: If you weren't sure when you entered this room, you are now sure you are looking at a pure demon.  This creature has been subjected by the Black Legion and seems content to play along with their goals.  He seems less than impressed with you though.

mobs.long_desc: Some of the moss seems interested in eating into more than just the palisade.
mobs.desc: It's green, somewhat slimey and looks harmless enough. When did moss get fangs?!?

mobs.long_desc: An unfinished mob stands here.
mobs.desc: It looks unfinished. I need K's luvins

mobs.long_desc: An unfinished mob stands here.
mobs.desc: It looks unfinished. I need K's luvins

objects.ground: A giant War Banner looms over the gate entrance.

objects.ground: A small pin lies here, covered in muck.

extras.text: This pin, made to be attached to a cloak or other armor as an identifying mark, shows a spear broken in half tipped in blood.  The spear is made of bronze and the blood is a kind of red enamel, attached to the backing which is slightly rusted steel.  It is the symbol of the Broken Spear mercenary brotherhood.

triggers.name: 3bl_qm_greet
triggers.commands: wait 2 if (%actor.align% <= 150 && %actor.quest_stage[Black_Legion]% == 0) msend %actor% %self.name% tells you, 'Hrm, fresh meat to fight the reach of the msend %actor% &0elven scum?' endif

triggers.name: 3bl_qm_initiate
triggers.argument_list: quest emissary elven scum hi hello yes
triggers.commands: * * This will recognize the acceptance of the Eldorian combat quests * and set the quest variable for later interaction. * if %actor.quest_variable[Black_Legion:eg_ally]% msend %actor% %self.name% tells you, 'You have already chosen your side!  Be msend %actor% &0gone, filth!' halt endif * This is for neutrals and evils only. if (%actor.align% <= 150 && %actor.level% > 9) wait 2 if %actor.quest_stage[Black_Legion]% == 0 quest start Black_Legion %actor.name% quest variable Black_Legion %actor.name% BL_FACTION 0 quest variable Black_Legion %actor.name% EG_FACTION 0 quest variable Black_Legion %actor.name% bl_ally 1 * Note that it is not necessary to initialize sub-quest * variables to 0 because non-existent quest variables * return the same as variables set to 0 in conditionals endif if (%actor.quest_stage[Black_Legion]% > 0 && %actor.quest_variable[black_legion:bl_faction]% > 99) msend %actor% msend %actor% %self.name% tells you, 'Yes, your service to the Legion has been msend %actor% &0acceptable.  Perhaps you can help on the front lines in our assault in Eldoria. msend %actor% msend %actor% %self.name% tells you, 'Go at once to Tarelithis!  Seek out the msend %actor% &0Third Black Legion Recruiter for further instructions!' halt endif msend %actor% msend %actor% %self.name% tells you, 'Yes, You will need to assist us in order to msend %actor% &0curry our favor.' msend %actor% msend %actor% %self.name% tells you, 'We have word the monks of the western vales msend %actor% &0are harboring agents of the Eldorian guard.  Go, raid the Abbey and lay waste msend %actor% &0to them and their ilk!' msend %actor% msend %actor% %self.name% tells you, 'If you bring me back &7&b[trophies]&0 of your msend %actor% &0victories, I will &7&b[reward]&0 you!' msend %actor% msend %actor% %self.name% tells you, 'If you like you can ask your &7&b[faction msend %actor% &0&7&bstatus]&0.' endif

triggers.name: 3bl_turn_in
triggers.commands: * * This is the main receive trigger for the Edorian * combat quests installed on the mud. This trigger * will be generic and the vnums and variables set * to reflect which faction it applies to. * * The original zone using these quests was * 55 Combat in Eldoria.  I'm adapting the * format of the quest mechanics to spread the * vast wealth of these quests to other zones * such that there isn't so much loot in one zone. * * 3bl is Third Black Legion - The player MUST be * on the quest already in order to turn in because * the variables are not set yet! if %actor.quest_variable[Black_Legion:eg_ally]% msend %actor% %self.name% tells you, 'You have already chosen your side!  Be msend %actor% &0gone, filth!' halt endif * if (%actor.align% <= 150 && %actor.quest_stage[Black_Legion]% > 0) quest variable Black_Legion %actor.name% bl_ally 1 * * pertinent object definitions for this faction * trophies * set vnum_3el_skull         5504 set vnum_3el_ring          5506 set vnum_3el_badge         5508 set vnum_3el_token         5510 set vnum_3el_insignia      5512 set vnum_3el_wand          5514 set vnum_3el_symbol        5516 * gems for this faction set vnum_gem_3bl_cap       55570 set vnum_gem_3bl_neck      55571 set vnum_gem_3bl_arm       55572 set vnum_gem_3bl_wrist     55573 set vnum_gem_3bl_gloves    55574 set vnum_gem_3bl_jerkin    55575 set vnum_gem_3bl_robe      55589 set vnum_gem_3bl_belt      55576 set vnum_gem_3bl_legs      55577 set vnum_gem_3bl_boots     55578 set vnum_gem_3bl_mask      55579 set vnum_gem_3bl_symbol    55580 set vnum_gem_3bl_staff     55581 set vnum_gem_3bl_ssword    55582 set vnum_gem_3bl_whammer   55583 set vnum_gem_3bl_flail     55584 set vnum_gem_3bl_shiv      55585 set vnum_gem_3bl_lsword    55586 set vnum_gem_3bl_smace     55587 set vnum_gem_3bl_light     55588 set vnum_gem_3bl_food      55566 set vnum_gem_3bl_drink     55567 * rewards set vnum_3bl_cap           5517 set vnum_3bl_neck          5519 set vnum_3bl_arm           5521 set vnum_3bl_wrist         5523 set vnum_3bl_gloves        5525 set vnum_3bl_jerkin        5527 set vnum_3bl_belt          5529 set vnum_3bl_legs          5531 set vnum_3bl_boots         5533 set vnum_3bl_mask          5535 set vnum_3bl_robe          5537 set vnum_3bl_symbol        5515 set vnum_3bl_staff         5539 set vnum_3bl_ssword        5540 set vnum_3bl_whammer       5541 set vnum_3bl_flail         5542 set vnum_3bl_shiv          5543 set vnum_3bl_lsword        5544 set vnum_3bl_smace         5545 set vnum_3bl_light         5553 set vnum_3bl_food          5555 set vnum_3bl_drink         5557 * * attempt to reinitialize slutty dg variables to '' (nothing) * so this switch will work. * unset is_gem unset exp_multiplier unset vnum_trophy unset faction_multiplier unset vnum_reward unset faction_required * * These cases set the variables for the quests. * Note the object.vnum is the vnum of the object handed to * the NPC by the player. * * These cases will only have the objects rewarded by this * questmaster though the full set of objects will be defined * by the script. * switch %object.vnum% case %vnum_gem_3bl_cap% set is_gem 1 set exp_multiplier 10 set vnum_reward %vnum_3bl_cap% set faction_required 20 set faction_multiplier 1 break case %vnum_gem_3bl_food% set is_gem 1 set exp_multiplier 10 set vnum_reward %vnum_3bl_food% set faction_required 20 set faction_multiplier 1 break case %vnum_gem_3bl_drink% set is_gem 1 set exp_multiplier 10 set vnum_reward %vnum_3bl_drink% set faction_required 20 set faction_multiplier 1 break case %vnum_gem_3bl_ssword% set is_gem 1 set exp_multiplier 10 set vnum_reward %vnum_3bl_ssword% set faction_required 20 set faction_multiplier 1 break case %vnum_gem_3bl_neck% set is_gem 1 set exp_multiplier 12 set vnum_reward %vnum_3bl_neck% set faction_required 40 set faction_multiplier 1 break case %vnum_gem_3bl_staff% set is_gem 1 set exp_multiplier 12 set vnum_reward %vnum_3bl_staff% set faction_required 40 set faction_multiplier 1 break case %vnum_gem_3bl_arm% set is_gem 1 set exp_multiplier 14 set vnum_reward %vnum_3bl_arm% set faction_required 55 set faction_multiplier 1 break case %vnum_gem_3bl_whammer% set is_gem 1 set exp_multiplier 14 set vnum_reward %vnum_3bl_whammer% set faction_required 55 set faction_multiplier 1 break case %vnum_gem_3bl_wrist% set is_gem 1 set exp_multiplier 16 set vnum_reward %vnum_3bl_wrist% set faction_required 70 set faction_multiplier 1 break case %vnum_gem_3bl_flail% set is_gem 1 set exp_multiplier 16 set vnum_reward %vnum_3bl_flail% set faction_required 70 set faction_multiplier 1 break case %vnum_3el_skull% set exp_multiplier 2 set vnum_trophy %vnum_3el_skull% set faction_multiplier 1 break case %vnum_3el_ring% set exp_multiplier 2 set vnum_trophy %vnum_3el_ring% set faction_multiplier 1 break case %vnum_3el_badge% set exp_multiplier 2 set vnum_trophy %vnum_3el_badge% set faction_multiplier 1 break case %vnum_3el_token% set exp_multiplier 2 set vnum_trophy %vnum_3el_token% set faction_multiplier 2 break case %vnum_3el_insignia% set exp_multiplier 2 set vnum_trophy %vnum_3el_insignia% set faction_multiplier 2 break case %vnum_3el_wand% set exp_multiplier 2 set vnum_trophy %vnum_3el_wand% set faction_multiplier 2 break case %vnum_3el_symbol% set exp_multiplier 2 set vnum_trophy %vnum_3el_symbol% set faction_multiplier 3 break default return 0 wait 1 eye %actor.name% msend %actor% %self.name% tells you, 'I am not interested in this from you.' msend %actor% %self.name% returns your item to you. halt break done * * need to force character saving after each turnin. * if !%is_gem% set faction_advance 0 set exp_advance 0 * hrmm Jelos' magical variable declaration if (%actor.quest_variable[black_legion:%vnum_trophy%_trophies]%) else quest variable black_legion %actor.name% %vnum_trophy%_trophies 0 endif eval trophies %actor.quest_variable[black_legion:%vnum_trophy%_trophies]% quest variable black_legion %actor.name% %vnum_trophy%_trophies %trophies% * The highest faction a player can gain from interacting with the 3rd front creatures will * be 200.  For this section the trophy turn in will reply on this and other checks. if (%actor.quest_variable[black_legion:bl_faction]% < 100) eval trophies %actor.quest_variable[black_legion:%vnum_trophy%_trophies]% + 1 quest variable black_legion %actor.name% %vnum_trophy%_trophies %trophies% wait 2 msend %actor% %self.name% tells you, 'Hrm, I see you have been out raiding the msend %actor% &0monks assisting the Eldorians.  According to my records you have now turned in msend %actor% &0have now turned in &3&b%trophies%&0 &7&b%get.obj_shortdesc[%vnum_trophy%]%&0.' mjunk %object.name% msave %actor% if (%trophies% < 10) set faction_advance 1 set exp_advance 1 else set faction_advance 1 endif else if (%trophies% < 10) set exp_advance 1 eval trophies %actor.quest_variable[black_legion:%vnum_trophy%_trophies]% + 1 quest variable black_legion %actor.name% %vnum_trophy%_trophies %trophies% else return 0 endif wait 2 eye %actor.name% msend %actor% %self.name% tells you, 'You have garnered as much favor with the msend %actor% &0Black Legion as you possibly can by raiding the Abbey.' msend %actor% msend %actor% %self.name% tells you, 'You may find other more difficult battles msend %actor% &0in Eldoria.' msend %actor% msend %actor% %self.name% tells you, 'Seek out the Third Black Legion Recruiter msend %actor% &0at the base of Tarelithis in order to curry more favor with our msend %actor% &0lords.' endif * * Double check that the criteria for rewards for this section are met. * if (%exp_advance% > 0) * * loop for exp award. * msend %actor% msend %actor% &3&bYou gain experience!&0 set lap 1 while %lap% <= %exp_multiplier% mexp %actor% 2640 eval lap %lap% + 1 done * * end exp loop * * all other items should be mpjunked or whatever by now endif if (%faction_advance% > 0) * * loop for faction award. * msend %actor% &3&bYour curry favor with the Black Legion!&0 msend %actor% &1&bYou feel more hated by the Eldorian Guard!&0 set lap 1 while %lap% <= %faction_multiplier% eval faction %actor.quest_variable[black_legion:bl_faction]% + 1 quest variable black_legion %actor.name% bl_faction %faction% * * * slight bug for now the trigger code can't seem to evaluate negative numbers? * * eval faction2 %actor.quest_variable[black_legion:eg_faction]% - 1 quest variable black_legion %actor.name% eg_faction %faction2% eval lap %lap% + 1 done * * end faction loop * * all other items should be mpjunked or whatever by now endif * end of !if_gem section or trophy endif msave %actor.name% endif if (%is_gem%) * hrmm Jelos' magical variable declaration if (%actor.quest_variable[black_legion:%vnum_reward%_reward]%) else quest variable black_legion %actor.name% %vnum_reward%_reward 0 endif eval rewards %actor.quest_variable[black_legion:%vnum_reward%_reward]% quest variable black_legion %actor.name% %vnum_reward%_reward %rewards% if (%actor.align% >= 151) return 0 wait 2 msend %actor% %self.name% tells you, 'You aren't quite evil enough for these msend %actor% &0rewards.' halt endif if (%actor.quest_variable[black_legion:bl_faction]% >= %faction_required%) eval rewards %actor.quest_variable[black_legion:%vnum_reward%_reward]% + 1 quest variable black_legion %actor.name% %vnum_reward%_reward %rewards% wait 2 msend %actor% %self.name% tells you, 'Ah yes, the Legion thanks you for your msend %actor% &0efforts.  Take this to aid you in your battles.' wait 1 mload obj %vnum_reward% wait 1 if (%actor.quest_variable[black_legion:%vnum_reward%_reward]% == 1) * * loop for exp award. * msend %actor% msend %actor% &3&bYou gain experience!&0 set lap 1 while %lap% <= %exp_multiplier% mexp %actor% 2640 eval lap %lap% + 1 done * * end exp loop * * all other items should be mpjunked or whatever by now endif if (%actor.quest_variable[black_legion:bl_faction]% < 200) * * loop for faction award. * msend %actor% &3&bYour curry favor with the Black Legion!&0 msend %actor% &1&bYou feel more hated by the Eldorian Guard!&0 set lap 1 while %lap% <= %faction_multiplier% eval faction %actor.quest_variable[black_legion:bl_faction]% + 1 quest variable black_legion %actor.name% bl_faction %faction% * * * slight bug for now the trigger code can't seem to evaluate negative numbers? * * eval faction2 %actor.quest_variable[black_legion:eg_faction]% - 1 quest variable black_legion %actor.name% eg_faction %faction2% eval lap %lap% + 1 done * * end faction loop * * all other items should be mpjunked or whatever by now endif mjunk %object.name% mjunk all.eldoria-trophy give all %actor.name% msave %actor.name% else return 0 wait 2 msend %actor% %self.name% tells you, 'You aren't quite allied enough with our msend %actor% &0cause to earn that reward.' halt endif * end of if_gem section endif else * Alignment not low enough or hasn't started the quest yet. return 0 wait 2 msend %actor% %self.name% tells you, 'You aren't quite allied enough with our msend %actor% &0cause to earn our rewards.  You need a lower alignement, or to start these msend %actor% &0quests by saying &7&b[yes]&0, &7&b[quest]&0, or &7&b[hello]&0.' endif

triggers.name: 3eg_qm_initiate
triggers.argument_list: quest sod undead masses hi hello yes
triggers.commands: * * This will recognize the acceptance of the Eldorian combat quests * and set the quest variable for later interaction. * * This is for neutrals and goods only. * wait 2 if %actor.quest_variable[Black_Legion:bl_ally]% msend %actor% %self.name% tells you, 'You have pledged yourself to the forces of msend %actor% &0darkness!  Suffer under your choice!' halt endif if (%actor.align% >= -150) if %actor.quest_stage[Black_Legion]% == 0 quest start Black_Legion %actor.name% quest variable Black_Legion %actor.name% BL_FACTION 0 quest variable Black_Legion %actor.name% EG_FACTION 0 quest variable Black_Legion %actor.name% eg_ally 1 * Note that it is not necessary to initialize sub-quest * variables to 0 because non-existent quest variables * return the same as variables set to 0 in conditionals endif if (%actor.quest_stage[Black_Legion]% > 0 && %actor.quest_variable[black_legion:eg_faction]% > 99) msend %actor% msend %actor% %self.name% tells you, 'Your help to us has not gone unnoticed.  I msend %actor% &0wonder...  Perhaps you can help on the front lines in our assault in Eldoria.' msend %actor% msend %actor% %self.name% tells you, 'Go at once to Tarelithis!  Seek out the Third msend %actor% &0Eldorian Guard Recruiter for further instructions! halt endif msend %actor% msend %actor% %self.name% tells you, 'Hrm, you will need to go assist us in our msend %actor% efforts in thwarting the Black Legion's influence.' msend %actor% msend %actor% %self.name% tells you, 'We understand that the Legion is in cahoots msend %actor% &0with the trolls of Split Skull.  If you wish to gain favor with the Eldorian msend %actor% &0Court then raid Split Skull.  Lay waste to their ranks!' msend %actor% msend %actor% %self.name% tells you, 'If you bring me back &7&b[trophies]&0 of your msend %actor% &0victories, I will &7&b[reward]&0 you!' msend %actor% msend %actor% %self.name% tells you, 'If you like you can ask your &7&b[faction msend %actor% &0&7&bstatus]&0.' msend %actor% endif

variables for the quests. * Note the object.vnum is the vnum of the object handed to * the NPC by the player. * switch %object.vnum% case %vnum_gem_3eg_cap% set is_gem 1 set exp_multiplier 10 set vnum_reward %vnum_3eg_cap% set faction_required 20 set faction_multiplier 1 break case %vnum_gem_3eg_food% set is_gem 1 set exp_multiplier 10 set vnum_reward %vnum_3eg_food% set faction_required 20 set faction_multiplier 1 break case %vnum_gem_3eg_drink% set is_gem 1 set exp_multiplier 10 set vnum_reward %vnum_3eg_drink% set faction_required 20 set faction_multiplier 1 break case exp_multiplier 16 set vnum_reward %vnum_3eg_wrist% set faction_required 70 set faction_multiplier 1 break case %vnum_gem_3eg_flail% set is_gem 1 set exp_multiplier 16 set vnum_reward %vnum_3eg_flail% set faction_required 70 set faction_multiplier 1 break case %vnum_3bl_skull% set exp_multiplier 2 set vnum_trophy %vnum_3bl_skull% set faction_multiplier 1 break case %vnum_3bl_ring% set exp_multiplier 2 set vnum_trophy %vnum_3bl_ring% set faction_multiplier 1 break case %vnum_3bl_badge% set exp_multiplier 2 set vnum_trophy %vnum_3bl_badge% set faction_multiplier 1 break case %vnum_3bl_token% set exp_multiplier 2 set vnum_trophy %vnum_3bl_token% set faction_multiplier 2 break case %vnum_3bl_insignia% set exp_multiplier 2 set vnum_trophy %vnum_3bl_insignia% set faction_multiplier 2 break case %vnum_3bl_wand% set exp_multiplier 2 set vnum_trophy %vnum_3bl_wand% set faction_multiplier 2 break case %vnum_3bl_symbol% set exp_multiplier 2 set vnum_trophy %vnum_3bl_symbol% set faction_multiplier 3 break default return 0 wait 1 eye %actor.name% msend %actor% %self.name% tells you, 'I am not interested in this from you.' msend %actor% %self.name% returns your item to you. halt break done * * need to force character saving after each turnin. * if !%is_gem% set faction_advance 0 set exp_advance 0 * hrmm Jelos' magical variable declaration if (%actor.quest_variable[black_legion:%vnum_trophy%_trophies]%) else quest variable black_legion %actor.name% %vnum_trophy%_trophies 0 endif eval trophies %actor.quest_variable[black_legion:%vnum_trophy%_trophies]% quest variable black_legion %actor.name% %vnum_trophy%_trophies %trophies% * The highest faction a player can gain from interacting with the 3rd front creatures will * be 200.  For this section the trophy turn in will reply on this and other checks. if (%actor.quest_variable[black_legion:eg_faction]% < 100) eval trophies %actor.quest_variable[black_legion:%vnum_trophy%_trophies]% + 1 quest variable black_legion %actor.name% %vnum_trophy%_trophies %trophies% wait 2 msend %actor% %self.name% tells you, 'Hrm, yes... you have been out fighting the msend %actor% &0influence of the Black Legion. * eval faction2 %actor.quest_variable[black_legion:bl_faction]% - 1 quest variable black_legion %actor.name% bl_faction %faction2% eval lap %lap% + 1 done * * end faction loop * * all other items should be mpjunked or whatever by now endif msave %actor.name% * end of !if_gem section or trophy endif endif if (%is_gem%) * hrmm Jelos' magical variable declaration if (%actor.quest_variable[black_legion:%vnum_reward%_reward]%) else quest variable black_legion %actor.name% %vnum_reward%_reward 0 endif eval rewards %actor.quest_variable[black_legion:%vnum_reward%_reward]% quest variable black_legion %actor.name% %vnum_reward%_reward %rewards% if (%actor.align% <= -151) return 0 wait 2 msend %actor% %self.name% tells you, 'You aren't quite good enough for these msend %actor% &0rewards.' halt endif if (%actor.quest_variable[black_legion:eg_faction]% >= %faction_required%) eval rewards %actor.quest_variable[black_legion:%vnum_reward%_reward]% + 1 quest variable black_legion %actor.name% %vnum_reward%_reward %rewards% wait 2 msend %actor% %self.name% tells you, 'Ah yes, the Guard thanks you for your msend %actor% &0efforts.  Take this to aid you in your battles.' wait 1 mload obj %vnum_reward% wait 1 if (%actor.quest_variable[black_legion:%vnum_reward%_reward]% == 1) * * loop for exp award. * msend %actor% msend %actor% &3&bYou gain experience!&0 set lap 1 while %lap% <= %exp_multiplier% mexp %actor% 2640 eval lap %lap% + 1 done * * end exp loop * * all other items should be mpjunked or whatever by now endif if (%actor.quest_variable[black_legion:eg_faction]% < 200) * * loop for faction award. * msend %actor% &3&bYour curry favor with the Eldorian Guard!&0 msend %actor% &1&bYou feel more hated by the Black Legion!&0 set lap 1 while %lap% <= %faction_multiplier% eval faction %actor.quest_variable[black_legion:eg_faction]% + 1 quest variable black_legion %actor.name% eg_faction %faction% * * * slight bug for now the trigger code can't seem to evaluate negative numbers? * * eval faction2 %actor.quest_variable[black_legion:bl_faction]% - 1 quest variable black_legion %actor.name% bl_faction %faction2% eval lap %lap% + 1 done * * end faction loop * * all other items should be mpjunked or whatever by now endif mjunk %object.name% mjunk all.eldoria-trophy give all %actor.name% msave %actor.name% else return 0 wait 2 msend %actor% %self.name% tells you, 'You aren't quite allied enough with our cause msend %actor% &0to earn that reward.' halt endif * end of if_gem section endif else * Alignment not high enough or hasn't started the quest yet. return 0 wait 2 msend %actor% %self.name% tells you, 'You aren't quite allied enough with our cause msend %actor% &0to earn our rewards.  You need a higher alignment or to start these quests by msend %actor% &0saying &7&b[yes]&0 or &7&b[quest]&0 or &7&b[hello]&0.' endif

Be msend %actor% &0gone, filth!' halt endif set vnum_trophy1 5504 set vnum_trophy2 5506 set vnum_trophy3 5508 set vnum_trophy4 5510 set vnum_trophy5 5512 set vnum_trophy6 5514 set vnum_trophy7 5516 if (%actor.align% <= 150 && %actor.quest_stage[Black_Legion]% == 1) msend %actor% msend %actor% %self.name% tells you, 'As you fight the allies of Eldorian Guard msend %actor% &0you will periodically find goods on their bodies that we will want in order to msend %actor% &0prove that you are working with us.' msend %actor% msend %actor% &0Items we're interested in are: msend %actor% - %get.obj_shortdesc[%vnum_trophy1%]% msend %actor% - %get.obj_shortdesc[%vnum_trophy2%]% msend %actor% - %get.obj_shortdesc[%vnum_trophy3%]% msend %actor% - %get.obj_shortdesc[%vnum_trophy4%]% msend %actor% - %get.obj_shortdesc[%vnum_trophy5%]% msend %actor% - %get.obj_shortdesc[%vnum_trophy6%]% msend %actor% - %get.obj_shortdesc[%vnum_trophy7%]% endif

triggers.name: p1_3eg_death
triggers.commands: * Adapted from Eldorian quest.  There is no gear to destroy in this rendition. * mecho %self.name%'s gear is destroyed in the battle! * mjunk all.eldoria-reward set vnum_trophy1 5504 set vnum_trophy2 5506 set vnum_trophy3 5508 set vnum_trophy4 5510 * * Death trigger for random trophy drops * * set a random number to determine if a drop will * happen. * set will_drop %random.100% * if %will_drop% <= 10 * drop nothing and bail halt endif if %will_drop% <= 50 mload obj %vnum_trophy1% elseif (%will_drop% >= 51 && %will_drop% <= 70) mload obj %vnum_trophy2% elseif (%will_drop% >= 71 && %will_drop% <= 90) mload obj %vnum_trophy3% else mload obj %vnum_trophy4% endif

triggers.name: bl_status
triggers.commands: msend %actor% if %actor.quest_variable[Black_Legion:bl_ally]% msend %actor% %self.name% tells you, 'You are pledged to the Black Legion.' endif if %actor.quest_variable[Black_Legion:eg_ally]% msend %actor% %self.name% tells you, 'You are pledged to the Eldorian Guard.' endif msend %actor% &0Your progress with our cause is as follows: msend %actor% &0Faction with The Black Legion: %actor.quest_variable[black_legion:bl_faction]% msend %actor% &0Faction with The Eldorian Guard: %actor.quest_variable[black_legion:eg_faction]%

rooms.name: A Mangrove Swamp
rooms.description: Constant humming and chattering of insect life is the overwhelming sensation here, along with the tang of saltwater and the smell of rot.  Passage is dangerous through these swamps - the roots of the mangrove trees are obstacles as much as the treacherous waters and shifting ground beneath them.  Twisting vines on the trees resemble snakes, and the snakes resemble the twisting vines on the trees.  The ocean is barely visible far to the east through the vegetation, and the ground seems to rise a bit to the west, though not by much.

rooms.name: A Mangrove Swamp
rooms.description: The hum and chitter of insects has died down a little here, but the smells of rot and salt have become even more intense.  To the east, a structure seems to rise out of the swamp, though there are no signs of a path leading to or from it.  Still, there are a few signs of non-animal passage: slashes on some mangrove trunks, a few bits of metal in the muck, and even, upon close inspection, some human-sized bones.

rooms.name: The Gate of Split Skull
rooms.description: Rising out of the swamp is a towering structure: a wooden gate connected to a high palisade of spiked logs.  The gates stand open to allow for heavy foot-traffic, and fortunately it seems that beyond them to the east is solid ground instead of swamp.  Posted as firmly as possible into the watery ground outside the gate are long spears and pikes adorned with skulls, some still holding the rotten flesh of their former owners.  The mangrove swamps continue to the west and south, and the outpost of Split Skull lies to the east.

rooms.name: Split Skull Gate Intersection
rooms.description: The ground, though muddy, is drier here than in the swamp itself.  The mud has been packed down fairly well by all the foot traffic coming in and out, as the main gate to Split Skull is directly west.  North and south, there is a pathway along the palisade wall that lines the encampment.  Off to the east, there seems to be a large fire burning.  Here at the intersection, it is easy to observe trolls, ogres, and other sinister-looking figures moving about from place to place.

rooms.name: Along the Decayed Palisade
rooms.description: The ground, though muddy, is drier here than in the swamp itself. The mud is packed well as this appears to be an often used patrol area behind the wooden fortification wall. Casting your gaze over the wall you notice it consists of long thick trees hewn and driven into the ground at an angle by very large beings.  The smell and moisture of the swamp permiate everything and seem to be eating into the logs of the wall.  Though moss grows very densely, feeding, on the wooden logs you remain convinced they will serve a good defense of the village for many decades to come.

Though moss grows very densely, feeding, on the wooden logs you remain convinced they will serve a good defense of the village for many decades to come.

rooms.name: Split Skull Gully
rooms.description: The main thoroughfare of the Split Skull encampment is little more than a straight path in the swampy muck.  Constant traffic has worn it down into a gully, lined by rocks from somewhere else and wooden buildings perched on stilts to keep dry.  Long buildings on either side can be entered to the north or south, and the road continues east and west.  East there is a large bonfire, and the gates lie to the west.

rooms.name: Split Skull Gully
rooms.description: The barracks rise to the north and south, but neither can be entered from here.  The swampy muck has been packed down into a fairly passable road here, although it's not as easy to travel as the Northern Swamp Road.  The buildings are set up on unsturdy-looking wooden stilts to keep the water away from them - apparently even the dryness of the roads is still unsafe.  To the east is a large fire and the main gate is to the west.

rooms.name: Split Skull Gully
rooms.description: The main thoroughfare of the Split Skull encampment is little more than a straight path in the swampy muck.  Constant traffic has worn it down into a gully, lined by rocks from somewhere else and wooden buildings perched on stilts to keep dry.  Long buildings on either side can be entered to the north or south, and the road continues east and west.  East there is a large bonfire, and the gates lie to the west.

rooms.name: Outpost Bonfire
rooms.description: Here at the center of the encampment, a crackling fire burns at all times of day and night, serving as a cooking fire for large game and heating the otherwise chilly outpost.  Although it seems like it would be difficult to find wood dry enough to burn, the fire is hot enough that even soaked mangrove wood catches after a little while, adding a ghostly blue color to the flames because of their high salt content.  The smell of peat is also strong, which is not surprising as there are stacks of it taller than a human.  It's probably imported from the nearby Northern Swamps as fuel for the fire.

rooms.name: Split Skull Gully
rooms.description: The main thoroughfare of the Split Skull encampment is little more than a straight path in the swampy muck.  Constant traffic has worn it down into a gully, lined by rocks from somewhere else and wooden buildings perched on stilts to keep dry, can be seen arrayed among the large trees that dominate the skyline. West there is a large bonfire, as the gully continues on to the village gates.

rooms.name: Split Skull Gully
rooms.description: The main thoroughfare of the Split Skull encampment is little more than a straight path in the swampy muck.  Constant traffic has worn it down into a gully, lined by rocks from somewhere else and wooden buildings perched on stilts to keep dry, can be seen arrayed among the large trees that dominate the skyline.  The air is a bit salty as if a coast is nearby and the constant flow of water through the town continues through the gully to the east.

rooms.name: Split Skull Gully
rooms.description: The main thoroughfare of the Split Skull encampment is little more than a straight path in the swampy muck. rooms.name: Split Skull Gully
rooms.description: The main thoroughfare of the Split Skull encampment is little more than a straight path in the swampy muck.  Constant traffic has worn it down into a gully, lined by rocks from somewhere else and wooden buildings perched on stilts to keep dry, can be seen arrayed among the large trees that dominate the skyline.  The air is a bit salty as if a coast is nearby and the constant flow of water through the town continues through the gully which ends in an abrupt slope under the village palisade.

rooms.name: Rocky Sluice
rooms.description: The passage between these trees and vegitation is only assisted by a path of rocks that run north and south through this section of the village.  The rocks are laid out carefully to form a path driven into the ground to channel rain water and keep the encampment as dry as possible.  The water in the sluice flows gently tward the center of the area while following the general tilt of the town slightly downhill to the east.  The exit to the west seems to be much quiter than the rest of the swamps.

rooms.name: Rocky Sluice
rooms.description: The passage between these trees and vegitation is only assisted by a path of rocks that run north and south through this section of the village. The water in the sluice flows gently tward the center of the area while following the general tilt of the town slightly downhill to the east.

The water in the sluice the flows gently tward the center of the area while following the general tilt of the town slightly downhill to the east.  The Split Skull Supply Hut is to the east.

The water in the sluice flows gently tward the center of the area while following the general tilt of the town slightly downhill to the east.  An unusually broad dry path leads to the base of one of the larger swamp trees to the east.

rooms.name: Rocky Sluice
rooms.description: The passage between these trees and vegitation is only assisted by a path of rocks that run north and south through this section of the village.  The rocks are laid out carefully to form a path driven into the ground to channel rain water and keep the encampment as dry as possible.  The water in the sluice flows gently tward the center of the area while following the general tilt of the town slightly downhill to the east.

rooms.name: Outpost Barracks
rooms.description: This is the western entrance of the Split Skull soldiers' barracks.  The smell of unwashed orc, troll, and ogre permeates the hall, and none of the bunks are as neat and orderly as is customary in human towns.  Still, at least the floors are clear.  The hall continues to the east and exits out to the south.

rooms.name: Outpost Barracks
rooms.description: Here in the central part of the outpost barracks, many soldiers' bunks line both walls and jut out into the main walkway, making it more difficult to move around.  Still, crushed belongings on the floor might explain why personal items are kept on beds and not in walkways - anything that gets in the way of a massive ogre or troll soldier isn't going to survive very long.  The barracks hall continues east and west.

rooms.name: Outpost Barracks
rooms.description: Somewhat neat and orderly for a building in the outpost, bunks line the walls of this long barracks hall.  Personal belongings are scattered along the bunks, but not along the floor.  The smell of unwashed soldiers is very strong here as well.  The barracks hall continues to the west and exits out to the main thoroughfare to the south.

rooms.name: Outpost Barracks
rooms.description: The walls of this long hut are lined in bunks and piled with personal items - it appears to be a barracks for the inhabitants of Split Skull.  The reek of sweat mingles with the faint scent of rotting wood, making it singularly unpleasant to be in this building.  There is an exit out to the main thoroughfare to the north, and the barracks continues to the east.

rooms.name: Outpost Barracks
rooms.description: Within the long barracks hall, it becomes apparent that there is at least a modicum of order in here.  Clothes, caltrops, and pointy weapons of all kinds are strewn all over the beds, but the floors remain conspicuously clear of impedimenta.  The barracks hall continues to the east and west.

rooms.name: Outpost Barracks
rooms.description: The southern barracks, judging by various cloaks and daggers laying around, seems to be the home of the rogues and spies of the encampment.  Keeping an eye on enemy movements is important, after all, so the rogues get a separate barracks hall from the rowdier soldiers.  The barracks continues to the west and exits out to the north.

rooms.name: Split Skull Supply Hut
rooms.description: This is a building.  No other structure visible on the ground level is as well constructed and you can tell that various inventory stretches in rows of shelves for quite a distance.

rooms.name: Split Skull Armory Hut
rooms.description: A large, three-walled hut is home to Split Skull's armory.  A hole in the ceiling lets the smoke of the forge fires through and the west wall is gone to facilitate escape of heat, as it quickly becomes stifling to be this close to fires used to work metal.  Weapons line the walls, ranging from crude but newly-fashioned local products to some of more obviously foreign manufacture - spoils of war, no doubt.  West is the only exit.

rooms.name: @RUNUSED ROOM@0
rooms.description: This room used to be a stable but now it's not.

rooms.name: Meditation Den
rooms.description: Standing higher off the ground than the other buildings of Split Skull, this roomy hut is quiet and peaceful.  The walls are draped with shamanic pictures drawn on tree bark and intricate symbols made out of vines and leaves.  There are even a few large pieces of leather with strange markings on them.  At the center of the hut, a smouldering fire burns and gives off intoxicating smoke from various swamp trees and grasses.  There are exits to the north and west.

rooms.name: Split Skull Training Grounds
rooms.description: This is a large open space walled off like an arena between the trees. Weapons of war can be seen broken across this field as well as training dummies with many weapons broken upon them.

rooms.name: Split Skull Tavern
rooms.description: Chairs and tables fly through the air often enough that you remain unconvinced that some magic is not behind their permanent airborne state.  The raucous drunken merriment might strike most as bewildering if most in the area didn't seem intent on participating as if their very lives depended upon it. This quite possibly could be the only place to be.  The carnage exits to the road outside to the south and continues on to the east.

rooms.name: Split Skull Tavern
rooms.description: Chairs and tables fly through the air often enough that you remain unconvinced that some magic is not behind their permanent airborne state.  The raucous drunken merriment might strike most as bewildering if most in the area didn't seem intent on participating as if their very lives depended upon it. This quite possibly could be the only place to be.  The sprawl of the tavern continues to the west as a rope ladder leads upwards.

rooms.name: Split Skull Inn
rooms.description: Climbing the ladder up the tree trunk out of the bar you notice that the noise of the party below quickly dissapates into a peaceful silence.  The ropes continue up the tree to pods of bedding that have been fastened to the giant vines that grow around the trees of the village that seem to almost reach the sky.

rooms.name: The Base of a Great Mangrove Tree
rooms.description: You stand at the base of a stiarcase that begins to spiral up the trunk of this large tree.  The staircase is wide as though it were made to accomodate very large beings.  The stairs lead up and a path back to the lower level of Split Skull is to the west.

rooms.name: Climbing the Tree
rooms.description: Landing from the steps places you still well above ground.  Even from here you can see most parts of town.  The bonfire in the center, the trees used to house the sleeping pods of the inn to the south west, the barracks and village gate to the west.  The stairs lead down to the town and a platform continues around the tree to the east.

rooms.name: Through the Limbs
rooms.description: Landing from the steps places you still well above ground.  Even from here you can see most parts of town.  The bonfire in the center, the trees used to house the sleeping pods of the inn to the south west, the barracks and village gate to the west.  The stairs lead up to the upper village and the landing platform continues around the tree to the west.

rooms.name: Mangrove Forest Platform
rooms.description: Landing from the steps places you well above ground.  From here much of the swamp seems visible and the general areas around are visible as well.  The Enchanted Hollow to the south, a large black destroyed fortress can be seen in the swamps to the north west well beyond the gates of Split Skull and the trees of the swamp.  A forrested village can also be seen to the south west.  Ripe for plunder this village may be.  The platform itself is solidly constructed from a dense wood that must be the same as the larger trees.  This section of the village is drier and sturdier than the rest of town.  It's as though the makers of this section are not the same as those responsible for the construction below.  The stairs lead down to the village, and the platform continues north among the trees.

rooms.name: Mangrove Forest Platform
rooms.description: This is about as high in the large trees as construction would be possible. There may have been some magical assistance in keeping these platforms in place even though the four largest Mangrove trees in the area are supporting this upper village above the sprawl of life in the swamp below.  The platform itself is solidly constructed from a dense wood that must be the same Mangrove supporting you.  The upper section of town is drier and sturdier than the rest of town.  It's as though the makers of this section are not the same as those responsible for the construction below.  The platform leads around the tree to the south and west.

rooms.name: Mangrove Forest Platform
rooms.description: This is about as high in the large trees as construction would be possible. There may have been some magical assistance in keeping these platforms in place even though the four largest Mangrove trees in the area are supporting this upper village above the sprawl of life in the swamp below.  The platform itself is solidly constructed from a dense wood that must be the same Mangrove supporting you.  The upper section of town is drier and sturdier than the rest of town.  It's as though the makers of this section are not the same as those responsible for the construction below.  The platform leads around the tree to an ornately constructed building to the south.  A rope plankway leads off to the north.

rooms.name: Black Legion Embassy
rooms.description: High in the trees of the swamps of southern Calia the undead have taken refuge.  This building is the office of the Emissary of the Black Legion.  The furnishings are spartan and the back of the building is loaded with supplies for war.  There is a large desk in the center of the front part of the building across from the doors.  You aren't quite sure the Emissary is alive or dead.

rooms.name: A Rope Plank Bridge
rooms.description: Expertly woven rope easily supports the largest of beings on patrol in this pathway through the canopy of the trees.  A light breeze sways the bridge slightly but no one around looks worried about the use of the walkway so high in the trees.  Various other platforms on other trees are visible from here.

rooms.description: This is about as high in the large trees as construction would be possible. There may have been some magical assistance in keeping these platforms in place even though the four largest Mangrove trees in the area are supporting this upper village above the sprawl of life in the swamp below.  The platform itself is solidly constructed from a dense wood that must be the same Mangrove supporting you.  The upper section of town is drier and sturdier than the rest of town.  It's as though the makers of this section are not the same as those responsible for the construction below.  The platform leads around the tree to the north.

rooms.name: A Rope Plank Bridge
rooms.description: Expertly woven rope easily supports the largest of beings on patrol in this pathway through the canopy of the trees.  A light breeze sways the bridge slightly but no one around looks worried about the use of the walkway so high in the trees.  Various other platforms on other trees are visible from here.

rooms.name: Dais of the Dark Flame
rooms.description: There is a large stone floor well fitted among the tree branches of this huge tree forming the base of a large temple building high in the forest canopy.  Magenta firelight flickers from braziers lining each wall.  A stairway exists the temple downward.  The temple extends to the north.

rooms.name: Temple of the Dark Flame
rooms.description: There is a large stone floor well fitted among the tree branches of this huge tree forming the base of a large temple building high in the forest canopy.  Magenta firelight flickers from braziers lining each wall.  The temple exits to the south.

rooms.name: Split Skull Stables
rooms.description: The smell of horses is overpowering within this hut, which is built directly on the ground rather than on stilts like most of the buildings in Split Skull. Straw is piled high on the muddy ground, and a nice selection of sinister-looking beasts wait for their new masters in the stalls.  Ornate harnesses covered in pointy bits are bunched along one wall, near the grooming supplies.  Clearly some residents of the village want their mounts to stay impeccable for their next raid on the innocent citizens of Caelia.  The exit is to the north.

rooms.name: The Backroom to Split Skull Stables
rooms.description: Stable back room.  You should not be here.  Tell a god.
